sentences: Rebecca Jean Fink (née Smallbone; born 26 July 1977), known professionally as Rebecca Jean or Rebecca St. James, is an Australian Christian pop rock singer-songwriter and actress.
She began performing in Australia in the late 1980s and released her first full-length studio album in 1991.
She began performing in Australia in the late 1980s and released her first full-length studio album in 1991.
She was signed to ForeFront Records in 1993, releasing her major label debut the following year.
She was signed to ForeFront Records in 1993, releasing her major label debut the following year.
St. James rose to fame in the late 1990s with her RIAA certified Gold albums God and Pray, the latter of which won a Grammy Award in 1999 for Best Rock Gospel Album, and her holiday album Christmas.
St. James rose to fame in the late 1990s with her RIAA certified Gold albums God and Pray, the latter of which won a Grammy Award in 1999 for Best Rock Gospel Album, and her holiday album Christmas.
St. James rose to fame in the late 1990s with her RIAA certified Gold albums God and Pray, the latter of which won a Grammy Award in 1999 for Best Rock Gospel Album, and her holiday album Christmas.

To date, she has released more than a dozen published books and appeared in eight films (including lead roles in Sarah's Choice and A Strange Brand of Happy), a musical stage show, and a VeggieTales episode ("An Easter Carol").
Rebecca St. James was born Rebecca Jean Smallbone on 26 July 1977, in Sydney, Australia to parents David and Helen Smallbone.
